key.stat.category.core.tooltip.name: Core Stats
key.stat.category.core.tooltip.descripti:
Your [key.stat.category.core](Core) stats are sort of like the 'building blocks' of your character.
They represent your fundamental strength, with many weapons, skills and spells scaling off of these stats.
Your [key.stat.category.core](Core) stats are responsible for many of your other sub-stats as well.
For instance, [key.stat.constitution] is what determines your [key.stat.health.max] and your [key.stat.stamina.max].
key.stat.category.health.tooltip.name: Health
key.stat.category.health.tooltip.descrip:
Your [key.stat.health] is reduced by any [key.mechanic.damage] you take.
When your [key.stat.health] reaches zero, you [key.mechanic.death](Die).
Try to avoid that!
key.stat.category.stamina.tooltip.name: Stamina
[key.stat.concentration] is used to maintain spells that require a greater degree of mental focus.
Some spells will lower your [key.stat.concentration.max] while they are active and others will actively drain your [key.stat.concentration] while you maintain them.
key.stat.category.posture.tooltip.name: Posture
key.stat.category.posture.tooltip.descri:
Your [key.stat.posture] represents how stable you are while [key.mechanic.block](Blocking).
As long as your [key.stat.posture] doesn't [key.mechanic.posture_break](Break), you will take [key.flavour.positive](no damage) while [key.mechanic.block](Blocking).
Weapons all have their own [key.mechanic.block_guard] values, which determines how much of the damage blocked is converted into [key.mechanic.posture_damage].
key.stat.category.magic.tooltip.name: Magic
key.stat.category.magic.tooltip.descript:
Magic represents your apptitude at casting spells.
Spells are cast using [key.stat.magic.mana].
[key.flavour.negative](Spellcasting is not yet implemented. Sorry!)
key.stat.category.attack.tooltip.name: Attack
key.stat.category.attack.tooltip.descrip:
Represents your apptitude at attacking with [key.flag.physical] attacks.
[key.flag.physical] attacks are typically made with [key.flag.melee] weapons and [key.flag.magic](non-Magical) [key.flag.ranged] weapons such as [key.item_tag.bow](Bows).
key.stat.category.movement.tooltip.name: Movement
key.stat.category.movement.tooltip.descr:
Movement represents how easily you move through the dungeon.
[key.stat.movement.speed] is an [key.flavour.important](incredibly powerful) stat, don't underestimate it!
key.stat.category.power.tooltip.name: Power
key.stat.category.power.tooltip.descript:
Your [key.stat.category.power] stats represent how strong the effects you create will be.
How much [key.stat.category.power] influences the strength of these effects is determined by the effect itself.
For instance, spells that are more specialized will have stronger, more focused scalings in fewer categories.
As an example, [key.flag.fire] spells may have a higher [key.stat.power.fire] scaling than it does [key.stat.magic.power] - meaning that each point of [key.stat.power.fire] you have matters more than each point of [key.stat.magic.power].
key.stat.category.penetration.tooltip.de:
Your [key.stat.category.penetration] stats are used to reduce your targets [key.stat.category.defense](Defensive) stats before your any [key.mechanic.damage] you deal is applied.
[key.stat.category.penetration] is a dual stat, it has a flat value and a percentage value [key.flavour.reminder]((you can swap between them by hodling CTRL.))
[key.stat.category.penetration] first reduces the targets [key.stat.category.defense] by the [key.stat.category.penetration] stats percentage value, and then reduce the targets [key.stat.category.defense] by the [key.stat.category.penetration](Penetrations) flat value.
This final [key.stat.category.defense] value is now used for the rest of the [key.mechanic.damage] calculation.
[key.stat.category.penetration] can bring a targets [key.stat.category.defense] below zero.
key.stat.category.resistance.tooltip.des: Your [key.stat.category.resistance](Resistances) are your ability to resist effects that are not otherwise affected by your [key.stat.category.defense] stats.
key.stat.category.defense.tooltip.name: Defense
key.stat.category.defense.tooltip.descri:
Your [key.stat.category.defense] stats are used to reduce incoming [key.mechanic.damage].
[key.stat.category.defense] ranges from [key.constant.defense_range_min] to [key.constant.defense_range_max], with higher values being stronger.
At [key.constant.defense_100] [key.stat.category.defense] [key.mechanic.damage] you receive will be [key.flavour.positive](reduced) by [key.constant.defense_damage_mult_100].
At [key.constant.defense_range_max] [key.stat.category.defense] [key.mechanic.damage] you receive will be [key.flavour.positive](reduced) by [key.constant.defense_damage_mult_max].
At [key.constant.defense_negative_100] [key.stat.category.defense] [key.mechanic.damage] you receive will be [key.flavour.negative](increased) by [key.constant.defense_damage_mult_negative_100].
At [key.constant.defense_range_min] [key.stat.category.defense] [key.mechanic.damage] you receive will be [key.flavour.negative](increased) by [key.constant.defense_damage_mult_min].
[key.mechanic.damage] is typed and will be reduced by your corresponding [key.stat.category.defense] stat (e.g. [key.flag.fire](Fire Damage) is reduced by your [key.stat.defense.fire]).
There are two exceptions to this, [key.stat.defense.armor] and [key.stat.defense.ward].
These will reduce all sources that are tagged as [key.flag.physical] and [key.flag.magic] respectively.
key.stat.category.misc.tooltip.name: Misc
key.stat.category.misc.tooltip.descripti:
[key.stat.category.misc](Miscellanious) stats that don't really belong in any other category.
Fuckin' I dunno where would you put [key.stat.misc.carry_weight], huh? Punk?
key.stat.grit.tooltip.name: Grit
key.stat.grit.tooltip.description:
[key.stat.grit] is a buffer of temporary [key.stat.health] that will be reduced before your real [key.stat.health] when you take [key.mechanic.damage].
[key.stat.grit] decays naturally over time and has no maximum.
The [key.flavour.important](higher) your [key.stat.grit] is the faster it will decay.
key.stat.magic.mana.tooltip.name: Mana
key.stat.magic.mana.tooltip.description:
[key.stat.magic.mana] is used to cast [key.mechanic.spellcasting](Spells), with higher level [key.mechanic.spellcasting](Spells) costing more.
[key.flavour.negative](Mana does not regenerate naturally).
Most [key.mechanic.spellcasting] classes will start each run with a [key.item_tag.flask] that can restore [key.stat.magic.mana].
key.mechanic.parry_window.tooltip.name: Parry Window
key.mechanic.parry_window.tooltip.descri:
Your [key.mechanic.parry_window] is how long in seconds after you start [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) that any attack [key.mechanic.block](Blocked) will instead be [key.mechanic.parry](Parried).
The default [key.mechanic.parry_window] is [key.variable.static](0.25 seconds).
key.mechanic.block_guard.tooltip.name: Guard
key.mechanic.block_guard.tooltip.descrip:
[key.mechanic.block_guard](Guard) determines how much of the [key.mechanic.damage](Damage) from attacks you [key.mechanic.block](Block) is converted into [key.mechanic.posture_damage].
[key.mechanic.block_guard] ranges from [key.variable.static]([key.constant.guard_range_min]) to [key.variable.static]([key.constant.guard_range_max]), with higher values being better.
At [key.variable.positive]([key.constant.guard_100]) [key.mechanic.block_guard], [key.mechanic.damage] you [key.mechanic.block] will be converted into [key.mechanic.posture_damage] with a [key.variable.positive]([key.constant.guard_damage_mult_100]) [key.flavour.positive](reduction).
At [key.variable.positive]([key.constant.guard_range_max]) [key.mechanic.block_guard], [key.mechanic.damage] you [key.mechanic.block] will be converted into [key.mechanic.posture_damage] with a [key.variable.positive]([key.constant.guard_damage_mult_max]) [key.flavour.positive](reduction).
At [key.variable.negative]([key.constant.guard_negative_100]) [key.mechanic.block_guard], [key.mechanic.damage] you [key.mechanic.block] will be converted into [key.mechanic.posture_damage] with a [key.variable.negative]([key.constant.guard_damage_mult_negative_100]) [key.flavour.negative](increase).
At [key.variable.negative]([key.constant.guard_range_min]) [key.mechanic.block_guard], [key.mechanic.damage] you [key.mechanic.block] will be converted into [key.mechanic.posture_damage] with a [key.variable.negative]([key.constant.defense_damage_mult_min]) [key.flavour.negative](increase).
[key.mechanic.damage] is typed and will be reduced by your corresponding [key.mechanic.block_guard] stats.
You can see your [key.flag.physical] [key.mechanic.block_guard] and your [key.flag.magic](Magical) [key.mechanic.block_guard] in the weapons stats panel (physical is the grey shield at the top, magical the blue shield at the bottom).
key.mechanic.guard_break.tooltip.name: Stability Break
key.mechanic.guard_break.tooltip.descrip:
[key.mechanic.guard_break](Stability Broken) enemies will become briefly [key.mechanic.stagger](Staggered).
Unlike regular [key.mechanic.stagger](Staggers), [key.mechanic.guard_break](Guard Breaks) also inflict [key.stat.posture_damage_enemy] equal to [key.variable.static](twice) the enemies [key.mechanic.stability].
key.mechanic.guard_damage.tooltip.name: Stability Damage
key.mechanic.guard_damage.tooltip.descri:
When you strike an enemy that is [key.mechanic.block](Blocking), and when you [key.mechanic.parry] an enemies attack, they will take [key.mechanic.guard_damage].
If an enemy takes enough [key.mechanic.guard_damage] they will suffer a [key.mechanic.guard_break].
key.mechanic.heft.tooltip.name: Heft
key.mechanic.heft.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.heft] determines how much [key.stat.stamina] it costs to perform actions with this item.
[key.flavour.important](Attacking) with a weapon costs [key.stat.stamina] [key.flavour.important](equal to) the [key.mechanic.heft] of the weapon.
Starting a [key.mechanic.block] with an item costs [key.stat.stamina] equal to [key.flavour.important](half) the [key.mechanic.heft] of the item.
[key.mechanic.block](Blocking) an attack costs [key.stat.stamina] [key.flavour.important](equal to) the items [key.mechanic.heft].
[key.mechanic.parry](Parries) will [key.flavour.positive](restore) [key.stat.stamina] equal to the items [key.mechanic.heft].
key.mechanic.execute.tooltip.name: Execute
key.mechanic.execute.tooltip.description:
When you strike a [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned) enemy on its [key.mechanic.weak_point] your strike will become a [key.mechanic.critical_hit] and you will perform an [key.mechanic.execute](Execution).
[key.mechanic.execute](Executions) deal [key.variable.static]([key.constant.execution_mult]) more [key.mechanic.damage] and [key.mechanic.trigger] [key.trigger.on_execute] effects.
key.mechanic.trigger.tooltip.name: Triggers
key.mechanic.trigger.tooltip.description:
Some effects will "[key.mechanic.trigger]" other effects.
For instance [key.trigger.on_parry] triggers are triggered whenever you successfully [key.mechanic.parry] an attack.
When an effect is [key.mechanic.trigger](Triggered) it may produce new results or augment whatever action initiated the [key.mechanic.trigger] in some way.
key.mechanic.parry.tooltip.name: Parrying
key.mechanic.parry.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.parry](Parries) will [key.flavour.positive](completely negate) the [key.mechanic.damage] of an attack and also prevent any [key.mechanic.posture_damage] you would've received.
You can [key.mechanic.parry] most attacks by [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) just before the attack lands.
You must start the [key.mechanic.block] within the [key.mechanic.parry_window] of the implement you're [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) with (0.25 seconds by default).
Successfully [key.mechanic.parry](Parrying) an enemy also inflicts [key.variable.static](1) point of [key.mechanic.posture_damage_enemy], however this damage will be incapable of [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy](Breaking) the enemies [key.stat.posture].
key.mechanic.block.tooltip.name: Blocking
key.mechanic.block.tooltip.description:
You can [key.mechanic.block] by holding an object capable of [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) (most weapons will work) in one of your hands and pressing your [key.input.block] key.
If you raise your [key.mechanic.block] within the [key.mechanic.parry_window] of the implement you're [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) with, you will instead [key.mechanic.parry] the attack.
When you [key.mechanic.block] an attack you will take [key.mechanic.posture_damage] based on the damage dealt by the attack and the [key.mechanic.block_guard] values on your blocking implement.
Higher [key.mechanic.block_guard] values will result in less [key.stat.posture] damage being received.
As long as your [key.stat.posture] stays above zero, you will take [key.flavour.positive](no damage) from the [key.mechanic.block](Blocked) attack. You may still receive some other effects from the attack, such as certain [key.flag.enchantment](Enchantments) still [key.mechanic.trigger](Triggering).
If your [key.stat.posture] reaches [key.flavour.negative](zero) you will be [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken) and any excess [key.mechanic.damage] will carry through as normal.
When [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken) you will be unable to block until your [key.stat.posture] fully recharges, however, you can still [key.mechanic.parry] even when [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken).
key.mechanic.posture_damage.tooltip.name: Posture Damage (Player)
key.mechanic.posture_damage.tooltip.desc:
[key.mechanic.posture_damage] is received (usually) when you [key.mechanic.block] an attack without [key.mechanic.parry](Parrying) it.
Some effects will be able to damage your [key.stat.posture] without being able to [key.mechanic.posture_break](Break) it.
 Taking [key.mechanic.posture_damage] does not carry any immediate downsides, but can be dangerous if you run out of [key.stat.posture].
If you [key.mechanic.block] an attack that takes your [key.stat.posture] to zero you will become [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken), preventing you from [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) until your [key.stat.posture] regenerates completely.
To read about how enemies are affected by this [key.mechanic.posture_damage_enemy](click here).
key.mechanic.posture_break.tooltip.name: Posture Break (Player)
key.mechanic.posture_break.tooltip.descr:
When an effect capable of breaking your [key.stat.posture] reduces it to zero you will become [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken).
The most common cause of this is [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) an attack without enough [key.stat.posture] to prevent all the damage.
Some effects can damage your [key.stat.posture] without [key.mechanic.posture_break](Breaking) it.
When [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken) your [key.mechanic.block](Blocks) [key.flavour.negative](will not prevent any damage) and you must wait until your [key.stat.posture] completely recharges before you will be able to [key.mechanic.block] again.
You are still able to [key.mechanic.parry] attacks even while [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Broken).
To read about what happens to enemies when they are [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy](Posture Broken, click here).
key.mechanic.posture_damage_enemy.toolti:
By default, you deal [key.mechanic.posture_damage_enemy] equal to half the [key.mechanic.damage] you deal with a weapon (modifiers and [key.flag.enchanted](Enchantments) not included).
If an enemy hits zero [key.stat.posture] they will be [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy](Posture Broken) and become [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned).
To read about how you are affected by [key.mechanic.posture_damage](Posture Damage, click here).
key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy.tooltip:
When you [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy] most enemies they will become [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned).
While an enemy is [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned) you can strike their [key.mechanic.weak_point] in order to perform an [key.mechanic.execute](Execution).
To read about how you are affected by [key.mechanic.posture_break](Posture Breaks, click here).
key.mechanic.stagger.tooltip.name: Staggers
key.mechanic.stagger.tooltip.description:
A [key.mechanic.stagger] is a short duration [key.flavour.important](interruption) of an enemies actions.
Some enemies may react to this, but otherwise, it just gives you a little breathing room.
key.mechanic.stability.tooltip.name: Stability
key.mechanic.stability.tooltip.descripti:
[key.mechanic.stability] represents how difficult it is to throw an enemy off-guard during combat.
You can [key.mechanic.guard_damage](Damage) an enemies [key.mechanic.stability] by striking them while they are [key.mechanic.block](Blocking) or by [key.mechanic.parry](Parrying) them when they attack.
If an enemy reaches [key.flavour.important](zero) [key.mechanic.stability], they will suffer a [key.mechanic.guard_break].
key.mechanic.poise.tooltip.name: Poise
key.mechanic.poise.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.poise] represents how difficult it is to [key.mechanic.stagger] an enemy through [key.mechanic.damage] during combat.
When you hit an attack, they will take [key.mechanic.poise_damage] based on what you hit them with.
If an enemy reaches [key.flavour.important](zero) [key.mechanic.poise] they will become [key.mechanic.stagger](Staggered).
key.mechanic.stun.tooltip.name: Stuns
key.mechanic.stun.tooltip.description:
When you [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy] an enemy they will usually becomed [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned).
While [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned) you may attack an enemies [key.mechanic.weak_point] in order to perform an [key.mechanic.execute](Execution).
An enemy being [key.mechanic.stun](Stunned) is a good opportunity to use your [key.item_tag.flask] or let your [key.stat.stamina] regenerate.
key.mechanic.kill.tooltip.name: Killing
key.mechanic.kill.tooltip.description:
When you reduce an enemies [key.stat.health] to their [key.stat.health.min] (typically 0), they [key.mechanic.death](Die).
This will [key.mechanic.trigger] [key.trigger.on_kill] effects.
key.mechanic.critical_hit.tooltip.name: Critical Hits
key.mechanic.critical_hit.tooltip.descri:
When you score a [key.mechanic.critical_hit] (usually by hitting an enemies [key.mechanic.weak_point]) you will increase the damage of your attack using your [key.stat.attack.critical_multiplier].
[key.mechanic.critical_hit](Critical Hits) are an effective way to greatly amplify your damage.
key.mechanic.weak_point.tooltip.name: Weak Points
key.mechanic.weak_point.tooltip.descript:
Most enemies will have a [key.mechanic.weak_point] somewhere on their body.
It wont always be obvious!
For the most part though you can intuit where it is (e.g. the head).
Attacking an enemies [key.mechanic.weak_point] with most weapons (and some [key.mechanic.spellcasting](Spells)) will score a [key.mechanic.critical_hit].
key.mechanic.stacks.tooltip.name: Stacks
key.mechanic.stacks.tooltip.description:
Some effects can [key.mechanic.stacks](Stack).
[key.mechanic.stacks] are used to represent effects that 'build upon' themselves when applied to a target that already has that effect (e.g. [key.status.bleed]).
Typically, The more [key.mechanic.stacks] an effect has the stronger it becomes, but what they do is ultimately up to the effect iself.
key.mechanic.death.tooltip.name: Death
key.mechanic.damage.tooltip.name: Damage
key.mechanic.damage.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.damage] is how you reduce an enemies [key.stat.health].
[key.mechanic.damage] can have its own types (e.g. [key.flag.fire] or [key.flag.poison]) and can be flagged as [key.flag.magic](Magical) or [key.flag.physical](Physical)
Rarely, [key.mechanic.damage] can have [key.flavour.important](multiple) types.
To read more about [key.mechanic.multi_type_damage](Multi-Type damage, click here.)
key.mechanic.damage_over_time.tooltip.de:
[key.mechanic.damage_over_time] is [key.mechanic.damage] that is dealt [key.flavour.important](periodically) (e.g. once per second) for some duration.
For instance, many [key.flag.poison] effects will apply [key.mechanic.damage_over_time](DoTs).
key.mechanic.multi_type_damage.tooltip.d:
[key.mechanic.multi_type_damage] is [key.mechanic.damage] that has more than one type.
e.g. [key.flag.fire] and [key.flag.frost] types combined will become [key.flag.frostfire].
[key.mechanic.multi_type_damage] is calculated using the same way single-type [key.mechanic.damage] with two key differences.
Firstly, you will add targets [key.stat.category.defense](Resistances) together for all relevant damage types and then you will apply all relevant [key.stat.category.penetration] stats to this combined number.
This means that you can benefit from having multiple high [key.stat.category.penetration] stats.
For instance, if an enemy has [key.variable.positive](100) [key.stat.defense.fire] but only [key.variable.positive](10) [key.stat.defense.frost], you will be able to deal drastically more damage by having high [key.stat.penetration.fire] and [key.stat.penetration.frost].
key.mechanic.rest.tooltip.name: Resting
key.mechanic.rest.tooltip.description: [key.flavour.negative](Resting isn't implement yet, so effects that rely on it wont recharge.)
key.mechanic.dual_wielding.tooltip.name: Dual-Wielding
key.mechanic.dual_wielding.tooltip.descr:
You are considered to be [key.mechanic.dual_wielding] when you are holding a [key.hold_type.one_handed] weapon in each hand ([key.item_tag.shield](Shields) excluded).
[key.mechanic.dual_wielding] is difficult without proper training, and incurs the following [key.flavour.negative](penalties:)
[key.constant.dual_wield_damage_penalty] [key.mechanic.damage][key.style.break_small][key.constant.dual_wield_attack_speed_penalty] [key.stat.attack.speed][key.style.break_small]+[key.constant.dual_wield_stamina_cost_increase] [key.stat.stamina.cost]
Some [key.hold_type.two_handed] weapons may also count as [key.mechanic.dual_wielding] when it makes sense.
In these cases, the weapon will have the [key.mechanic.dual_wielding] flag.
key.mechanic.projectile.tooltip.name: Projectiles
key.mechanic.projectile.tooltip.descript:
[key.mechanic.projectile](Projectiles) are objects that are launched by weapons, items, certain attacks from enemies or [key.mechanic.spellcasting](Spells).
[key.flag.physical] weapons (e.g. [key.item_tag.bow](Bows)) will fire [key.flag.physical] [key.mechanic.projectile](Projectiles) while [key.flag.magic](Magical) effects such as [key.mechanic.spellcasting](Spells) will fire [key.flag.magic](Magical) [key.mechanic.projectile](Projectiles).
key.mechanic.spellcasting.tooltip.name: Spellcasting
key.mechanic.strafing.tooltip.name: Strafing
key.mechanic.backpedaling.tooltip.name: Backpedaling
key.mechanic.turncap.tooltip.name: Turncap
key.mechanic.turncap.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.turncap] is the limit to how quickly you can look around during attacks with weapons.
Heavier weapons usually have lower [key.mechanic.turncap](Turncaps), meaning you wont be able to turn as quickly while attacking with them.
This is separate to your mouse sensitivity and cannot be avoided by increasing it.
key.trigger.on_hit.tooltip.name: On Hit (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_hit.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.trigger](Triggers) whenever you successfully land an attack.
Some effects will restrict what you need to land the attack with.
e.g. only attacks with [key.flag.melee] weapons.
key.trigger.on_damaged.tooltip.name: On Damaged (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_damaged.tooltip.descripti:
[key.mechanic.trigger](Triggers) whenever [key.flavour.important](you) take [key.mechanic.damage].
Usually doesn't [key.mechanic.trigger] for [key.mechanic.damage_over_time] effects.
key.trigger.on_parry.tooltip.name: On Parry (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_block.tooltip.name: On Block (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_block.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.trigger](Triggers) whenever you successfully [key.mechanic.block] an attack.
[key.mechanic.parry](Parries) will also [key.mechanic.trigger] [key.trigger.on_block] effects.
key.trigger.on_guard_break.tooltip.name: On Stability Break (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_stagger.tooltip.name: On Stagger (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_execute.tooltip.name: On Execute (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_stun.tooltip.name: On Stun (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_stun.tooltip.description: [key.mechanic.trigger](Triggers) whenever you [key.mechanic.stun] an enemy, typically by [key.mechanic.posture_break_enemy](Posture Breaking) them.
key.trigger.on_death.tooltip.name: On Death (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_death.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.trigger](Triggers) whenever you would [key.mechanic.death](Die).
Some effects may prevent your [key.mechanic.death] or otherwise change how it plays out.
key.trigger.on_kill.tooltip.name: On Kill (Trigger)
key.trigger.on_kill.tooltip.description:
[key.mechanic.trigger](Triggers) whenever you [key.mechanic.kill] an enemy.
Some effects will also require you to [key.mechanic.kill] the enemy in specific ways.
key.trigger.on_activate.tooltip.name: On Activation
key.flag.melee.tooltip.name: Melee
key.flag.melee.tooltip.description:
Smacking an enemy with a stick is a [key.flag.melee] attack. So is punching them in the face.
Very occasionally, some [key.flag.ranged] or [key.mechanic.spellcasting] options may count as a [key.flag.melee] attack for the purpose of [key.mechanic.trigger](Triggering) extra effects.
key.flag.ranged.tooltip.name: Ranged
key.flag.ranged.tooltip.description:
Shooting an enemy with an arrow is an example of a [key.flag.ranged] attack.
Some [key.mechanic.spellcasting](Spell) attacks may also be flagged as [key.flag.ranged]. [key.mechanic.spellcasting](Spells) will have tags to show what flags they have.
key.flag.physical.tooltip.name: Physical
key.flag.physical.tooltip.description:
Attacks are usually flagged as [key.flag.physical] when you're hitting something with a physical object, such as a [key.item_tag.sword] or [key.item_tag.arrow].
Some [key.mechanic.spellcasting](Spells) may count as [key.flag.physical] if, say, they throw a physical object at you, such as a boulder made of earth.
key.flag.magic.tooltip.name: Magic (Flag)
key.flag.magic.tooltip.description:
Attacks flagged as [key.flag.magic](Magical) usually come from [key.mechanic.spellcasting](Spells) or sometimes [key.flag.enchanted] weapons.
However it got the flag, [key.flag.magic] attacks are usually harder to defend against.
key.flag.enchanted.tooltip.name: Enchanted (Flag)
key.flag.enchanted.tooltip.description:
[key.flag.enchanted] items are imbued with special properties beyond what they would ordinarily have.
These effects are so broad that trying to describe them here is silly.
Go find them!
key.flag.healing.tooltip.name: Healing (Flag)
key.flag.healing.tooltip.description:
[key.flag.healing] effcts include anything that restores [key.stat.health].
[key.flag.healing] effects can be flagged as both [key.flag.magic](Magical) and [key.flag.physical](Physical).
